etymologies: late 19th century; earliest use found in Henry Watts (1815–1884), chemist. From German Helleborëin from scientific Latin Helleborus, genus name + German -ëin

definitions: A toxic alkaloid present in several species of hellebore (genus Helleborus), especially black hellebore, H. niger.

notes.text: Helleborein is a cardiac glycoside. Formula: C₃₇H₅₆O₁₈.
